text:
hey everyone today we're gonna do something 
a little different but very important we're

gonna take a break from cooking to talk about 
cleaning because unfortunately one leads to the

other whether you like it or not yes I know I hate 
cleaning too but that is why we got to talk about

this because the more efficiently we clean the 
better the more enjoyable the cooking right so

today I'm gonna share with you five of my kitchen 
tips to help minimize the amount of cleaning that

you have to do but because there are obviously 
more than five things you can do I have partnered

up with Melissa maker from clean my space and 
she's gonna give us even more tips so Melissa

is the queen of cleaning on YouTube she's also 
authored this fantastic guidebook on cleaning

called clean my space so she's going to give us 
five tips on how you can clean as you go which

I know we can all do a bit more of right so don't 
forget to check out that video after this but for

now let's get started the first tip I have is 
cold water rinse now the default mode for most

of us is to have dirty dishes throw them in the 
sink and put some hot water on it right well that

doesn't work for everything if you've got dough 
for example hot water will actually cook the bits

of dough that's on your bowl right onto the bowl 
then it's even harder to get off what you want

to do then is soak the bowl in some cold water 
which will dissolve the flour come cleanup time

it'll come off super easy if you're in a hurry 
you don't have time to soak scrape it off with

a rubber spatula right and that will prevent the 
dough from getting stuck into like these little

scrubby things if you've got ground meat say for 
making burgers and meatballs or whatever give it

a rinse first with cold water get off all the 
meat especially if you use the food processor

now you've got ground meat stuck in like the 
nooks and crannies of the food processor once

you cook that on with hot water it's impossible 
to get off lastly little bits of cheese left from

grating and whatnot scrape that into the garbage 
first if that makes it into your sink you hit it

with hot water the cheese melts now you've got 
gooey cheesy mess that's getting in your brushes

and your sponges it's a nightmare listen I love 
a big beautiful wooden cutting board as much as

the next chef it's beautiful and I uses on the 
show but let me tell you a secret when I'm at

home and I gotta cook a lot I don't use this cuz 
it's a pain to clean especially if you got to like

wash the boards in between multiple times this is 
what I use tada thin flexible cutting mats so the

great thing about this is once your dirty one you 
just change out another one and yeah they usually

are sold in sets too and the good thing is because 
they take up almost no space you can just slip it

on the side of your sink the dirty one or just 
put it on the side of your dishwasher and they

take almost no room in the dishwasher but because 
these are so light and thin you're gonna want to

stabilize it with a wet paper towel underneath 
so it doesn't move around or you can get one that

comes with a stabilizing platform like this so 
the way this works is you just put a board on it

and the grooves hold it in place which is super 
useful oh and the cool thing about this guy is

these boards I'll store right in here I know it 
might be second nature to just throw everything

you produce into the thing but you'll be surprised 
how many of those dishes don't actually need to be

washed they just need a good rinse with hot water 
so things like a measuring cup you use for sugar

or flour a bowl you use for your vegetables and 
so what I do is I keep a space on the counter

designated for those types of dishes right and 
as I use them I just throw them in there comes

dishwashing time give them a good rinse with hot 
water and you are good to go this next tip when I

learned about it it changed my life I mean ever 
try to get oyster sauce or honey or things that

are thick and sticky out of a measuring cup 
or measuring spoon impossible right you're

now like scraping it off with something else 
now you've got to dirty things instead of one

or you're like sitting there banging everything 
it's splattering everywhere here's what you do

you grease your measuring cup or spoon either 
with a nonstick spray or if you don't have one

just put a little oil in it and swirl it around 
and then it'll slide out like a dream and now

you will actually get one tablespoon of oyster 
sauce as opposed to one tablespoon - whatever

you couldn't get out of the spoon right and also 
put it in a squeeze bottle and this applies for

all thick and sticky things this so much time and 
this glugging business this has just got to stop

and finally plan your chopping organization is 
everything and I really had to learn this when

I worked in catering company when we had to cut 
a whole bunch of different things quickly so if

you've got a bunch of things to cut and they don't 
need to be cut in any particular order you want to

start first with the cleanest ingredients so 
anything that's not getting cooked like salad

vegetables or fresh fruit you want to cut that 
first when the board is absolutely pristine okay

because remember if it's not getting cooked the 
bacteria on it is not getting killed then when

you're done that you can move on to sort of 
dirty or Messier vegetables like onions where

it's you're gonna get flakes of skin everywhere 
and you're gonna get that gooey white SAP on the

board and then raw meat you want to leave that to 
the end because once rami touches your board it

has got to go so if you plan accordingly you won't 
have to wash your cutting board unnecessarily in

between and that is it for me if you've got more 
cleaning tips to share please share them with us

we could all use more cleaning tips right so 
and don't forget to check out the other half

of this video over at Melissa's channel the 
link to that will be in the description below

as always if you are new to the channel welcome 
and please take a look around we do educational

and fun cooking videos on this channel lots of 
Thai food but also a lot more and you can also

hang out with me on facebook twitter or instagram 
at hot thai picture and I will see you next time
